result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles C. Leofilos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles C. Leofilos is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Charles C. Leofilos was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission  Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Charles C. Leofilos in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 to Disorderly Conduct, 947.01(1).    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court approves to amend Ct. 1 to Disorderly Conduct, 947.01(1), Class B Misd.

Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to accept the agreement.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1:  Court orders 30 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; concurrent to his current Green Lake County sentence, 15CF92
Report forthwith
May serve in Green Lake County
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
bond to be applied
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan for the balance:  $50.00/month commencing on July 1, 2017

Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Final pre-trial on December 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles C. Leofilos in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Trial.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for January 12, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
